title: South Live: Thursday 29 March - BBC News
summary: croydon cat killer suspected in hampshire pet deaths .
industrial action planned by staff at south western railway .

documents.title: boy , 3 , killed in supermarket lorry crash
text: boy , 3 , killed in supermarket lorry crash

documents.title: good evening and have a happy easter !
text: the bbc south live service resumes next week .
stay in touch via our oxford , hampshire , dorset , and berkshire facebook pages , or on twitter at @ twitterid @ twitterid @ twitterid and @ twitterid
in the meantime , have a very happy easter .

documents.title: departing council leader regrets backing 'super council '
text: the departing leader of an oxfordshire council has said he regrets backing a major shake-up of local government in the county .
south oxfordshire leader john cotton previously spoke in favour of turning the county into one unitary authority - abolishing the districts .
after announcing he 's stepping down - he toldoxford he regrets supporting the unitary bid , which is currently being looked at by government .
the debate has got to be about what is the right scale .
we are seeing in places like northamptonshire the government is targeting figures of around 300 , 350 [ thousand people ] .
oxfordshire as a unitary authority on its own would be 700,000 , maybe 800,000 people , that 's a big place to manage for one council .

documents.title: bray restaurateur 's new scotland venture
text: the owner of the triple michelin star waterside inn in bray is opening a new restaurant in scotland .
alain roux is setting up the new venture at edinburgh 's balmoral hotel with his father michael roux .
it will open in may and is part of a £ 3m renovation of the hotel .

documents.title: royal wedding : tough windsor security measures to be introduced
text: windsor will be cordoned off and people will have to go through full body scanners to get to the town as part of the royal wedding security measures .
a `` screening and search '' regime will be introduced in the run-up to prince harry 's marriage to meghan markle at st george 's chapel on 19 may .
police would not confirm the exact date of when the secure zone would be implemented for security reasons .
more than 100,000 people are expected to arrive in the town for the big day .

documents.title: man left unconscious after attack in portsmouth
text: a 31-year-old man was knocked unconscious after an attack in a tunnel near gunwharf quays in portsmouth earlier .
he was one of two men targeted as they walked from gunwharf quays to the hard at about 01:30 bst .
police say he was taken to queen alexandra hospital and are asking for help to identify three people .
two men from portsmouth have been arrested - one aged 24 was held on sus of causing grievous bodily harm with intent , the second aged 21 was also arrested but has been released without charge .

documents.title: any questions ? comes to oxford
text: oxford town hall is to host bbc radio 4 's political panel show any questions ?
it is to be broadcast from oxford town hall on 13 april and free tickets are being made available to local residents .

it takes place between 18:30 and 21:00 in the main hall , with tickets available on a first come first serve basis at oxford town hall , east oxford community centre , blackbird leys community centre , and rose hill community centre .

documents.title: charity helps rehabilitate veterans with scuba-diving
text: a small charity that helps veterans who 've been seriously injured or left with mental health issues has been recognised for its work .
deptherapy , based in berkshire , teaches former servicemen and women to scuba-dive which has helped many deal with their trauma .
it 's been nominated as a finalist in the soldiering on awards which celebrate achievements of those who 've served in the forces .

documents.title: driver admits grandfather death charge
text: driver admits grandfather death charge

documents.title: man in court over 'fail-to-stop ' crash
text: a man has appeared in court after a pedestrian was injured by a car which crashed and caught on fire .
thomas carey , 26 , was struck by a volvo s60 , which also collided with a ford c-max , an audi and a wall in bevois hill , southampton , on tuesday at 14:15 bst .

gentjan lalaj , 20 , of hazelwood lane , palmers green , north london , is charged with causing serious injury by dangerous driving , having no insurance or driving licence and failing to stop after a road collision .
he was remanded in custody by southampton magistrates to appear at the city 's crown court on 30 april .

documents.title: britain 's oldest men mark 110th birthday
text: britain 's oldest men mark 110th birthday

documents.title: wareham street reopened after fatal collision
text: north street in wareham has reopened following the collision that killed a three-year-old-boy .
it was shut between the junction with west street and the roundabout at the junction with the a351 from before 09:00 until just after 15:00 while investigation work was carried out .
insp matt butler , of the traffic unit at dorset police , said : `` very sadly i can confirm that a three-year-old boy has died today following a collision .
our thoughts are with his family and friends at this very traumatic time .
they have requested privacy . ''
the sainsbury 's lorry driver , a 43-year-old man from basingstoke , is being held on sus of driving offences .
mike coupe , sainsbury 's chief executive , said in a statement : `` this is an absolute tragedy and we will do everything we can to support the family . ''

documents.title: ccg board agrees to keep services at horton general
text: the horton general hospital will not lose key services under new proposals agreed today by oxfordshire 's nhs bosses .
a public consultation was set to decide the future of the a & e department and paediatric services at banbury 's horton general hospital , but it has now been cancelled .
phase one of the consultation met `` almost universal '' opposition and health bosses said they would approach phase two `` in a very different manner '' .
the changes were agreed at a meeting of the oxfordshire clinical commissioning group board .

documents.title: young women found 'seven hours after crash '
text: two 18-year-old college friends were found dead more than seven hours after their car careered off the road and crashed into trees , police have said .
ella alford and aimee clayton were found in a fiat 500 at the side of the a30 near the hatch pub in basingstoke , hampshire , at 05:00 bst on wednesday .
police believe the car hit some trees at about 22:30 the previous evening .
they went to peter symonds college in winchester whose principal said they `` both had such bright futures ahead '' .

documents.title: oxfordshire 's big picture
text: oxfordshire 's big picture

documents.title: maundy money given in windsor
text: the queen has marked maundy thursday by taking part in the ancient ceremony of distributing commemorative coins to deserving pensioners .
the presentation of the money has taken place during the royal maundy service at st george 's chapel , windsor castle .
the queen distributed the maundy money to 92 men and 92 women - as she will be 92 this year - with each recipient receiving two purses , one red and one white .
this year , the red purse contains a £ 5 coin , commemorating four generations of royalty , and a 50p coin commemorating the representation of the people act 1918
both coins have been minted in 2018 .

documents.title: cat deaths 'linked to croydon cat killer '
text: cat deaths 'linked to croydon cat killer '

documents.title: hampshire resident celebrates 110th birthday
text: a man living in alton in hampshire is celebrating his 110th birthday today .
robert weighton shares the title of britain 's oldest man with alfred smith from perthshire who also turns 110 today .
robert - who is originally from hull - said he was just `` one of the lucky ones '' to live so long .
he worked as an engineer , spending time in taiwan , japan and canada and now lives in a flat in a care complex at alton .
`` i have not lived my life avoiding being run over by buses or getting cancer or anything else , '' he said .
`` i 've done nothing to deserve or achieve this age . ''

documents.title: breakingboy , 3 , killed by lorry on zebra crossing
text: a three-year-old boy has died after being hit by a lorry on a zebra crossing .
the collision happened shortly before 09:00 on north street in wareham , dorset .
the boy was crossing the road with his family at the time , dorset police said .
he was taken to dorset county hospital with serious injuries and died shortly afterwards .
the coroner has been notified .
a 43-year-old man from basingstoke has been arrested on sus of driving offences .

documents.title: windsor lockdown for royal wedding
text: windsor lockdown for royal wedding

documents.title: robinson 's under-23s vision for oxford
text: robinson 's under-23s vision for oxford

documents.title: tributes to lost volvo ocean race yachtsman john fisher
text: tributes have been paid to a sailor presumed lost at sea after he was knocked overboard during a round-the-world race in the southern ocean .
john fisher , 47 , from southampton , fell from team sun hung kai 's scallywag yacht on monday .
dee caffari , skipper of rival yacht turn the tide on plastic , said `` many tears '' had been shed for `` a gifted sailor who was doing what he loved '' .
the scallywag crew is currently sailing to chile , the nearest land .

documents.title: royal wedding security details released
text: policing the royal wedding will be the largest ever operation in thames valley police 's history , the force has said .
on saturday 19 may prince harry and megan markle will marry at st george 's chapel , windsor castle .
thames valley police says people should expect to see more police officers , both armed and unarmed , and search dogs in advance of the wedding .
it 's expecting more than 100,000 people to visit windsor for the wedding and says spectators may be stopped and checked by roads policing officers on the day .

documents.title: wareham road closed after collision
text: a street in a dorset town has been closed and the air ambulance is on the scene following a collision .
dorset police and dorset and wiltshire fire and rescue service are also present at north street in wareham after the incident which happened shortly before 09:00 .
the road is closed between the junction with west street and the roundabout at the junction with the a351 .
a police spokesman said : `` we would like to ask motorists to be patient whilst this incident is being dealt with and investigated . ''
north st closed to traffic from square .
police and fire brigade attending incident somewhere near kings arms
i wondered what was happening .
hope everyone is alright .

documents.title: # lifegoeson as council leader departs
text: using the hashtag # lifegoeson john cotton announced on twitter this morning that he wo n't submit his name for the upcoming conservative group elections .
that means in turn he 'll no longer be leader of south oxfordshire district council .
it comes after he lost a crucial vote on the local plan earlier this week - with the majority of his party voting against him .
he said he 's made the decision not to run in the leadership race with `` some sadness '' - but says he will remain a councillor until next year 's election at least .
author: Bethan Phillips
Political reporter, BBC Radio Oxford

documents.title: malala returns to pakistan for first time
text: malala yousafzai , who is currently studying at the university of oxford , has returned to pakistan for the first time since being shot by taliban militants .
ms yousafzai , now aged 20 and a vocal human rights activist , was shot in the head by a gunman for campaigning for female education in 2012 .
she is expected to hold meetings with prime minister shahid khaqan abbasi .
details of the trip have been kept secret `` in view of the sensitivity '' , an official told afp news agency .

documents.title: breakingsouth oxfordshire council leader steps down
text: john cotton has stepped down from his role as leader of south oxfordshire district council .
in a message on twitter , he said it had been a `` huge honour '' to lead the district and thanked staff at the authority .
mr cotton was facing a leadership challenge within the conservative group .
in his message he said he plans to continue as a councillor representing berinsfield , dorchester and drayton st leonard `` at least until the elections next year '' .

documents.title: crane bids to return in 50-over cricket
text: crane bids to return in 50-over cricket

documents.title: race yachtsman 'was knocked off boat '
text: more details have been released about how a southampton sailor was lost at sea during a round the world yacht race .
john fisher 's volvo ocean race team says he was washed overboard into the southern ocean when he unclipped his tether to tidy up a line .
the team looked for him for several hours in gale force conditions before taking the decision to abandon the search .
the team 's manager - tim newton - says the loss was devastating .

documents.title: croydon cat killer suspected in hampshire pet deaths
text: two recent cat killings have injuries `` consistent '' with others committed by the so-called croydon cat killer .
animal rescue charity snarl said two cats mutilated recently in the south were killed at the same time .
police said one mutilated body had been found in a garden in the thicket in fareham , hampshire .
the met began investigating a series of `` gruesome '' killings - which initially began in the croydon area in 2015 .

documents.title: spinnaker tower to turn pink for cancer charity
text: the spinnaker tower will be turning pink for `` wear a hat day '' later .
the annual fundraising campaign is held to support brain tumour research .
it says brain tumours kill more children and adults under the age of 40 than any other cancer but receives only 1 % of the national spend on cancer research .

documents.title: industrial action at south western railway
text: members of the rmt union at south western railway ( swr ) are set to begin a weekend of industrial action at midnight .
the union says it 's part of a dispute over safety , the role of the guard , and operation of the doors by the driver .
it has asked driver and guard members not to work on rest days or to follow elements of their terms and conditions which allow flexibility around shift start and finish times .
the action ends at midnight on monday .
swr is planning to maintain full service and says it will do everything it can to minimise the impact .

documents.title: banbury businesses on brexit with one year to go
text: it is exactly one year until the uk formally leaves the eu .
there will then due be a 21-month transition period before the final arrangements kick in .
jon kay from bbc breakfast has been in banbury talking to businesses and residents to hear their thoughts with 12-months to go .
tim from banbury cakes said : `` i think it is just a slow shambles , an expensive slow shambles , and it 's pulled the economy down . ''
malcolm , who runs a men 's clothing store , said : `` i believe that we will get a reasonable deal , it 's not in their interest to charge us , it 's not in our interest to charge them .
`` it 's like a divorce , there 's always problems , but in the end result both of you go away and are perhaps happier for it '' .
author: Jon Kay
BBC Breakfast

documents.title: rail upgrades in west oxfordshire 'must happen ' , says mp
text: the number of trains between oxford and west oxfordshire need to be doubled , an mp has said .
conservative robert courts raised the matter with transport minister joe johnson during a debate on upgrading the cotswold line .
there is just one track for parts of the line and mr courts said the solution to increasing capacity was having a second line of track at least as far as hanbrough .
`` this simply must happen as soon as possible if we are to establish faster and more frequent journeys to and from london '' , he said .
in response joe johnson accepted the cotswold line had potential for `` further upgrading and development '' .
watch # westminsterhall debate led by @ twitterid on upgrades to the cotswold line

documents.title: good morning
text: welcome to south live on thursday 29 march , the easter weekend is nearly in sight !
as normal we will endeavor to bring you latest news , travel updates and sports headlines from around the region until 18:00 .
you can get in touch via our oxford , hampshire , dorset and berkshire facebook pages or using twitter , our accounts are : @ twitterid @ twitterid @ twitterid and @ twitterid
